data.name: The Thrill of the Fight
data.description:
The Thrill of the Fight is a down-to-earth VR boxing game focused on authenticity. Enter a virtual gym and battle a series of unique challengers with their own styles and techniques. Use timing and skill to land the knockout blow. Evade swings, land jabs, and block punches to become the king of the ring!

Room scale is required with a minimum supported play area size of 6.5ft by 6.5ft (2m by 2m). Please ensure your Guardian boundaries are set up properly for room scale and that you are willing to move and punch anywhere within and around the play area you have defined.

changelog.change_log:
This is a major patch including changes that have been collecting on the beta channel since December 2020.

November 5
-------------------------
* Fixed bug causing hooks to nearly always use 95% mass credit
* Fixed Quest Pro not running at 90hz
* Fixed "NaN" errors in damaging punch total stats

October 11
-------------------------
* Added Drift Protection setting back to the menu as "Strict Drift Protection", which uses the same distance limit that Drift Protection previously used.
* Removed eye reflections
* Reduced the amount of range boost provided by the Range Boost setting
* Restored the ability for users with a stationary boundary to recenter
* Stunned visual effects don't apply until you have received 20% stun value

October 9
-------------------------
* Improved graphics, resolution, and refresh rate
* Added passthrough mode
* Much more accurate tracking caused by an Oculus SDK upgrade
* A new "Range Boost" setting has been added to emulate the old tracking feel
* Recentering with the Oculus button sets a new front edge for your play area
* Improved punch type detection
* Removed damage penalty from jabs
* Force adjustment system now displays an intended "force target" instead a multiplier
* Force adjustment system now always increases your multiplier slightly after each round
* Added separate manual force adjustment values for jabs and uppercuts
* Revamped Settings menu
* Increased audience count and animation variety
* Added option for simplified crowd graphics in gym
* Added "Default" venue option to custom fight settings
* Mixed Reality Capture improvements
* Expanded post-match scoring details tabs and added more post-match punch stats
* Fixed right crosses being tied to the left cross frequency customization settings

This is a major patch including changes that have been collecting on the beta channel since December 2020.

* Improved graphics, resolution, and refresh rate
* Added passthrough mode
* Much more accurate tracking caused by an Oculus SDK upgrade
* A new "Range Boost" setting has been added to emulate the old tracking feel
* Recentering with the Oculus button sets a new front edge for your play area
* Improved punch type detection
* Removed damage penalty from jabs
* Force adjustment system now displays an intended "force target" instead a multiplier
* Force adjustment system now always increases your multiplier slightly after each round
* Added separate manual force adjustment values for jabs and uppercuts
* Revamped Settings menu
* Increased audience count and animation variety
* Added option for simplified crowd graphics in gym
* Added "Default" venue option to custom fight settings
* Mixed Reality Capture improvements
* Expanded post-match scoring details tabs and added more post-match punch stats
* Fixed right crosses being tied to the left cross frequency customization settings

* Updated bHaptics SDK to latest release to fix pairing bugs
* Head hits now rumble more motors on the TACTAL mask to try to make the vibrations feel stronger
--------
* bHaptics pairing UI now shows an outline on devices that are available to pair
* Fixed bug with the bHaptics pairing menu where it would only show one device as being paired after coming back to the pairing menu after a fight, even though other devices were still paired
--------
* Added support for bHaptics devices. Use the new bHaptics option on the main menu to pair the hardware with the Quest. You'll need to allow TotF permission to access Bluetooth (shown as location permissions).
* Added support for Quest mixed reality capture.
* Added multiplier reset button to the Configuration quick-view panel to the right of the main menu. This button will only appear when you have the "Automatic Force Adjustment" enabled, and will let you quickly reset your multiplier if you feel it is stuck too low or if you are handing off the headset to another player.
* When the AI is lightly dizzed, it will only throw with its typical punch output when cornered. Previously, the AI would change from its lower punch output when significantly dizzy directly to its high punch output from being cornered. Switching to normal punch output under light dizziness helps the transition between the two.

* Changed loading screen to a solid black background to address reports of nausea
* Fixed logo to always face forward during loading scene
* Provided some new Settings menu options
* Fixed issue causing Halloween fights to appear after you finished a normal fight if you had previously played a Halloween fight during a play session
* Corrected "hook mass multiplier" name on main menu config panel
